articles.description: Talks between the US and Iran appear to have reached an impasse, increasing tensions in the Middle East.
articles.content:
US to partially evacuate embassy in Iraq over security threats
Non-essential US embassy staff and their dependants in Baghdad are evacuating from Iraq due to heightened security risks, US government sources said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Brian Wilson, Beach Boys visionary leader and summer's poet laureate, dies at 82
articles.description: Brian Wilson, the Beach Boys’ visionary and fragile leader whose genius for melody, arrangements and wide-eyed self-expression inspired “Good Vibrations,” “California Girls” and other summertime anthems and made him one of the world’s most influential recording artists, has died at 82.

articles.title: Solar Orbiter captures unprecedented views of sun's turbulent south pole
articles.description: Virtually all space probes that explore the sun from space view our star from the ecliptic. This is the plane in which the planets orbit the sun. Although this plane is slightly tilted relative to the sun's equator, the angle of about 7° is not enough to catch a clear view of our star's poles. Solar telescopes on Earth naturally have the same limited perspective.
articles.content:
This article has been reviewed according to Science X's editorial process and policies . Editors have highlighted the following attributes while ensuring the content's credibility:

articles.title: Q&A: Researcher discusses mapping how nutrients move through the body to treat cancer
articles.description: When you swallow a vitamin or eat a meal, the nutrients you've ingested flow into your stomach, break down, and enter your bloodstream. But what happens next? How do nutrients move from your arteries into the cells where they actually do their jobs? What determines whether some nutrients go to the brain, while others power your immune system instead?

articles.title: One year later, work on epilepsy medication inquiry is yet to begin
articles.description: Brid O'Flaherty was made chairwoman of the inquiry in June 2024
articles.content:
Work has yet to begin on an inquiry into the prescribing of epilepsy medicine, a year after a chairperson for the probe was appointed — on a 12-month contract.

articles.title: Pentagon launches review of US-UK-Australia Aukus security alliance
articles.description: Future of $240bn defense pact in doubt as Trump administration reviews it to see it aligns with ‘America first’ agenda
articles.content:
